posts.body:
No cloudflare means Watkins can't afford DDOS protection
Fullchan is ded

Based
>>83848305-2db6-4ed2-956e-840f853f0b67
Cloudflare is doing an IPO in September
They just needed an excuse to drop places like 8ch. This is just the beginning

The manifesto was posted on Instagram. Tarrant hosted the livestream on facebook.
Both /pol/ posts were taken down within minutes. Yet 8ch is the one that gets dropped.
Mind that /pol/ wasn't even a plurality of the userbase

Couldn't be better though. The faster everyone moves away from the DNS and Cloudflare monopolies, the better

>>075f95e4-6812-4441-86f2-da5687c4831e
Might surprise you, but most spics are christian

>>786db8c4-faed-4c6d-aa12-ff3569252a00
>8ch was literally just nuked because of capitalism
>Proven wrong

>>e446db6d-9e70-4c40-8317-1f53974f3930
It wasn't feds that shut fullchan down (surprisingly). It was private business deciding that propping up places like /pol/ would hurt their profit margins

>>f5a6f296-37e6-43d0-a11f-f6bca73daa0f
Capitalism isn't just about the exchange of goods, but for-profit production
And if you hurt shareholders profit margins, they'll deplatform you. Pointing that out has nothing to do with being a commie nigger
>>72207310-e66b-48fa-a965-bd33cbc964e5
Apparently not so much that they're keeping It around as a honeypot, or able to prevent the 3 attacks
**Or maybe that was the plan all along, who knows**

>>b8b59271-8bf7-4b5d-a389-8bc16e253bd7
Halfchan was Rome, Fullchan was the ERE. This is the Renaissance.
Mute pizza boards

>>f7483597-d57a-4827-9f25-e07cd435a7d3
You're not seeding unless you've loaded the content, pinned the board or enabled "download and help distribute files"
If you do the latter, you better VPN + Tor (in that order), or you risk being v&

There was a case years ago where the cock.li admin got raided over something similar; just because you haven't "seen" the content, doesn't make it less illegal in many jurisdictions.

So is the only way to seed all '''existing''' files to enable the ''distribute all files'' option? (Instead of just pinning the board)
I'd love to seed all existing content, but I don't want to risk seeding cp boards.

>>41da7763-c0ad-4ab7-9e26-f9ac460518a7
>1000 posts
Threads with tons of images become sluggish and unreadable way before that point when using Tor. I wouldn't mind tumbnail quality being reduced further.
>Triage
Isn't this what pinning is for? It's up to users to seed content. But it reduces anonymity at low numbers...
I'd like the option to seed the top 10, 20, 100, etc. boards. Combined with a size limit.

>>8e6a113e-c7a1-4911-9a8f-60cb8412519b
Even China can't stop ZeroNet. And governments have been trying to crack down on torrents for ages.
P2P is the end of censorship.

>Muh shills
Okay retard. It's p2p so even if you're right it doesn't matter
Learn2Opsec

**[M]**

>>da588f3a-d65f-444a-9f45-7cc191cabddc
If you've ever browsed clearnet 8ch during a cp raid, those thumbnails are saved to your pc
Social media companies, webhosts, etc. are unwittingly hosting CP. How many have gotten in trouble for it?

You should be running VPN + Tor anyway

[M]
**Why can't we sage on this board?**
Just change your certificate

>>3bdfd5ba-d221-46dd-9bec-ab3c98d97597
>Go back to Jim's CIA honeypot with servers hosted in the US and everyone's IPs saved in cleartext
Okay

**[M]**

Cryptocurrency already have p2p verification. Wouldn't be impossible to implement a captcha.

>>e65979fa-51b5-4874-831d-9f8e9dcd1205

>>5115
It's scripted. But it should be possible to run a captcha through p2p
